Key Match Events: Jamal Murray led the way with 21 points and nine assists.
The Nuggets had six players in double figures in Wednesday's resounding win over the Clippers.
Russell Westbrook scored 11 of his 19 points in the third quarter, including a rock-the-baby celebration after an and-one against Norman Powell.
Michael Porter Jr. scored 19 points and grabbed eight rebounds.
DeAndre Jordan contributed 12 points and nine rebounds.
Norman Powell led the Clippers with 30 points, while James Harden was held to 16 points on 15 shots.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Michael Malone reminisced about a previous win against the Clippers without Nikola Jokic, Jamal Murray, and Aaron Gordon.
The Nuggets were coming off a back-to-back after playing the defending champion Celtics.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Michael Malone emphasized the importance of not losing two games in a row and praised the team's performance.
Malone noted the impact of the game on the standings, highlighting the importance of the win in maintaining their position.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nuggets are now 8-0 on the second night of back-to-backs but 3-6 after two or more days without a game.
Kawhi Leonard was absent from the Clippers' lineup to be with his family amid wildfires in the Los Angeles area.
The NBA scheduled a fourth regular-season game between the Nuggets and Clippers after both teams were eliminated from the NBA Cup.
